title: Plate, ca. 1937
markings: Underside: in red overglaze, two crossed "L"s within upright rectangle, "France" beneath. In green underglaze on D,E, & L: "France / CA in monogram/...?...DEPOSE"
provenance: Purchased by donor at the Paris Exposition, 1937.
dimensions: H x diam.: 2.5 x 21.3 cm (1 x 8 3/8 in.)
description: Circular plate with red-orange enamel ground featuring geometric decoration of two wide L-shaped gilded bands and one wide L-shaped platinum band. Plane white glaze on reverse. (One of a set of 12 plates. 1969-97-14a/l.)

tombstone.epitaph:
Plate, ca. 1937.
ca. 1937. Porcelain, enamel, gold, platinum. Gift of James M. Osborn. 1969-97-14-a.
